etymology.description: Pictogram: one-half of 門 (“gate”); original form similar to 𠁣.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a single leaf of a gate or door, evoking the entrance to a dwelling. The sense broadened from the physical door panel to the notion of a household as a unit.
etymology.simplification: Adopted a long-used clerical/cursive variant with fewer strokes, streamlining 戶 to 户 for easier writing while preserving the door-leaf outline.

examples.chinese: 小区有一千多户居民(小區有一千多戶居民)。
examples.pinyin: Xiǎoqū yǒu yīqiān duō hù jūmín.
examples.english: The neighborhood has over a thousand households.

examples.chinese: 每户都按时缴费(每戶都按時繳費)。
他把户口迁到了上海(他把戶口遷到了上海)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bǎ hùkǒu qiān dào le Shànghǎi.
examples.english: He transferred his household registration to Shanghai.
